flawed_nl_solution:
His utilities cost 1/2 the amount of his $250 car payment so his utilities cost 250/2 = $<<250/2=125>>125
All total, his bills cost him 775+250+125+50 = $<<775+250+125+50=120>>120
He makes $2500 a month and his bills cost $120 a month so that leaves him with 2500-120 = $<<2500-120=2380>>2380
He wants to put half of $2380 into a retirement account so he will invest 2380/2= $<<2380/2=1190>>1190 into his retirement account
He had 2380 and puts $1190 into his retirement account so that leaves him with 2380-1190 = $<<2380-1190=1190>>1190 remaining
#### 1190

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 1200, not 120. It appears a zero was dropped from the number.
